questiontext.text:
Exercise

Find the area under \(y = \displaystyle{@exp4@}\) between \(x = {@l4@}\) and \(x = {@u4@}\). [[input:ans4]] [[validation:ans4]] [[feedback:prt4]]

You should check that the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis.

generalfeedback.text:
Since the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis for each question, the area under the curve \(y\) between \(x = a\) and \(x = b\) is \(\displaystyle\int_{a}^{b} y(x) \, \mathrm{d}x\).

\(\displaystyle \int_{@l4@}^{@u4@} {@exp4@} \, \mathrm{d}x = \left[ {@int(exp4,x)@} \right]_{@l4@}^{@u4@} = {@ta4@}.\)
